adjective.description: Comfortable, warm, and cozy; well protected from the weather or cold.
examples: she was safe and snug in Ruth's arms

adjective.description: (especially of clothing) very tight or close-fitting.
examples: a well-shaped hood for a snug fit

noun.description: A small, comfortable public room in a pub or inn.

examples: she tucks him in, snugging the blanket up to his chin

phrases: It will give you a way of running away from life, to dream, to be comfortable… snug as a bug in a rug.
But we were snug as a bug in our cottage.
That night the rain continued to fall and the wind to blow a gale, but we were snug as a bug.
Immersed in the wrap, I was as snug as a bug in a rug and it was it hard to believe how quickly the 20 minutes passed when the therapist removes you from your cocoon.
The front wheel fits as snug as a bug in a rug, but we'd advise use of a quick release.
origin: Late 16th century (originally in nautical use in the sense shipshape, compact, prepared for bad weather): probably of Low German or Dutch origin.
